summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Jeffrey Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy (2002-2005) and one count of sex trafficking. It details a systematic scheme where Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, paying them cash and using victim-recruiters to expand his network. The indictment names specific employees and victims by placeholder identifiers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The indictment alleges he sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his homes in New York and Florida from at least 2002 to 2005, paying them cash and using a network of victim-recruiters.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the indictment on behalf of the United States government.

connections.description: Employee-1, a New York-based employee, facilitated Epstein's abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters at the New York Residence.
Employee-2, an assistant, facilitated Epstein's abuse by contacting minor victims in Florida to schedule encounters at the Palm Beach Residence, sometimes while both were in New York.
Employee-3, an assistant, facilitated Epstein's abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters at the Palm Beach Residence.

Minor Victim-1 was recruited around 2002, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the New York Residence over years, paid cash, and enticed to recruit other girls. Epstein asked her age and she answered truthfully.
Minor Victim-2 was recruited around 2004, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence over years, paid cash, and enticed to recruit other girls.

Minor Victim-3 was recruited around 2005, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence over years, paid cash, and enticed to recruit other girls. Epstein asked her age and she answered truthfully.

events.title: Sex Trafficking Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Jeffrey Epstein is charged with conspiring to commit sex trafficking of minors, involving the sexual exploitation of dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida.

events.title: Employee-1 calls Minor Victim-1
events.description: Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Employee-2 calls Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3
events.description: Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed telephone calls to Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 to schedule appointments for them to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Employee-3 calls Minor Victim-3
events.description: Employee-3 placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-3 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

locations: Manhattan, New York (specifically the Upper East Side, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Palm Beach, Florida (referred to as the 'Palm Beach Residence')
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (specifically listed as forfeitable property, owned by Maple, Inc.)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the court)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is formally charged with sex trafficking conspiracy (2002-2005) and sex trafficking of minors, specifically involving victims as young as 14.
The indictment alleges Epstein used a network of employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule sexual encounters with minor victims at his homes in New York and Florida.
Epstein is accused of paying victims hundreds of dollars in cash per encounter and incentivizing certain victims to recruit other minor girls, creating a self-sustaining supply of victims.
The document identifies three specific minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and states Epstein knew they were underage because some told him their age when asked.
The government seeks forfeiture of specific property, including Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc.
